title: Fix cropped bottom of earthquake results table list

requirements.text: Fix the layout/scrolling of the earthquake results table so the bottom of the table list is not visually cropped and the last row can be fully viewed in all view modes (Table and Split). Address the height interaction between the fixed 600px table scroll container in `frontend/src/components/earthquake/EarthquakeResultsTable.tsx` and the `h-[600px] overflow-hidden` wrapper used in Split view in `frontend/src/pages/EarthquakeDashboard.tsx`.

quotes: can you fix the cropped bottom of this table list

acceptanceCriteria: In Table view, scrolling to the end of the list shows the last row fully (no bottom clipping/cropping).
In Split view, the EarthquakeResultsTable is not clipped by its parent container; the table area is scrollable and the last row is fully visible.
The table header remains usable/visible (no regressions to the existing sticky header behavior).
No changes are made to read-only shadcn/ui component source files under `frontend/src/components/ui`.

constraints: Frontend immutable paths must not be edited: `frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts`, `frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx`, `frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts`, `frontend/src/main.tsx`, and all files under `frontend/src/components/ui`.
Keep the existing virtualized rendering behavior in `frontend/src/components/earthquake/EarthquakeResultsTable.tsx` (do not remove virtualization).
nonGoals: Backend changes (Motoko) are not required for this UI layout fix.
Do not redesign table columns, filters, or sorting as part of this fix.
